forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 5 to 12 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. North wind 2 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a gentle layer of cloud hangs softly above, creating a calm yet slightly elusive atmosphere. The temperatures dip toward the mid-forties, inviting a light jacket or sweater for comfort against the cool breeze nudging down from the north. Visibility is fair, with hints of the city skyline emerging against a backdrop of muted blues and grays, a paintbrush of clouds tracing their way across the sky; the famed Golden Gate Bridge stands proudly, the fog that often cloaks it nowhere to be seen. 

The forecast hints at a mellow day ahead, where the morning will greet us with partly sunny intervals, promising a high near sixty-three, before cascading to the pleasant mid-fifties come afternoon. The winds, nimble yet gentle, dance between two and sixteen miles per hour, offering an invigorating touch to your stroll through the streets. As the sun rises, consider a visit to one of the local coffee shops to enjoy a steaming cup while traversing the tree-lined avenues, or perhaps a stroll along the waterfront to breathe in the fresh marine air—just don’t forget your sweater for when the sea breeze nudges you. Balmy, yet slightly brisk— it’s a comforting San Francisco evening, just perfect for a reflective walk or an intimate gathering with friends at your favorite café.
